title: Court Dismisses Ex-Marathon Director Chris Barrett’s $200M Lawsuit Against Bungie and Sony
content: A Delaware judge has tossed Christopher Barrett’s $200M lawsuit against Bungie and Sony, not on the facts, but because the case was filed in the wrong court. Former Marathon director Christopher Barrett filed his lawsuit against Bungie and Sony on December 12, 2024 , claiming the companies wrongfully fired him and did it, in his view, to dodge tens of millions in payments tied to Bungie’s post-acquisition agreements. The lawsuit came after public reporting about why Bungie let him go . Bloomberg reported that an internal investigation found Barrett acted inappropriately toward multiple women at the studio, and that at least eight female employees raised complaints. The report described things like flirty messages, comments about looks, and “truth-or-dare” conversations. Image: Bungie Related: Sony Details ‘Disturbing’ Text Messages in Response to Ex-Bungie Director Chris Barrett’s $200M Lawsuit From Barrett’s side, the story has been that Bungie and Sony used him as a “scapegoat” and fired him to avoid paying him money tied to Bungie’s Sony acquisition and related deals. From Sony and Bungie’s side, the argument has been that he was terminated “for cause” after multiple reports from employees, and they’ve said they’ll fight the claims. Now, there’s a big development. In a new court order filed on December 10, 2025, and obtained by The Game Post, Delaware’s Court of Chancery has dismissed the case . Delaware court dismisses Chris Barrett lawsuit against Bungie and Sony The biggest thing to understand is that the judge did not decide who’s telling the truth about what happened at Bungie. Instead, the Court of Chancery said it cannot hear this dispute at all , because what’s left in the lawsuit is essentially about money damages . The order explains that the Court of Chancery is a limited court. It mainly handles certain kinds of disputes, like cases where someone is asking for special “equitable” fixes, not just money. “The case is dismissed for lack of jurisdiction,” the order reads. “The Court of Chancery is a court of limited jurisdiction. It possesses subject matter jurisdiction only when ‘(1) one or more of the plaintiff’s claims for relief is equitable in character, (2) the plaintiff requests relief that is equitable in nature, or (3) subject matter jurisdiction is conferred by statute.'” Image: Bungie Related: Bungie Takes Down Marathon ViDoc Featuring Former Director Chris Barrett Following Reports Of Inappropriate Behaviour The order also shows how this got to this point. On October 13, 2025 , the court issued an order asking why the case should not be thrown out for lack of jurisdiction. “On October 13, 2025, the court issued an order to show cause why the case should not be dismissed for lack of subject matter jurisdiction. Dkt. 62. Only the defendants argued that subject matter jurisdiction exists. Dkt. 65. The Employee was happy to transfer the case to Superior Court. “Under Court of Chancery Rule, this court must dismiss a lawsuit when it lacks subject matter jurisdiction. This court has an independent obligation to evaluate whether subject matter jurisdiction exists.” The court walks through a few different attempts to keep the case in Chancery, and rejects them one by one. A lot of it comes down to the same idea that even if the dispute is tied to stock awards, merger-related agreements, or a payment plan, the remaining fight still looks like a fight over money payments , which is usually a “regular court” issue, not a Chancery issue. There’s also a moment where Sony and Bungie argued that questions about interest could matter later, and the judge basically says that is not enough to decide jurisdiction. “The defendants also contend that any claim to an award of interest would require interpreting the Merger Agreement. The question of interest will not come up until the end of the case, and then only if the Employee prevails. It is also unlikely that there will be a significant dispute over the interest rate. The interest rate tail should not wag the jurisdictional dog.” Image: Bungie Related: Sony and Bungie Call Former Director Chris Barrett’s $200M Lawsuit ‘Baseless Attempt To Obtain Hundreds Of Millions’ And when it comes to Barrett’s FMLA-related requests, the order notes that he asked for reinstatement, but the judge says it’s very unlikely the court would actually do that, and that money damages would probably cover it anyway. “Here, reinstatement may be theoretically available, but it is highly unlikely that the court would grant it. A damages remedy is highly likely to be adequate.” What happens next This dismissal does not automatically mean the dispute is over. The order lays out that Barrett can choose to move the case to Delaware Superior Court under a state transfer rule. “The plaintiff can make a timely election to have the matter transferred to the Delaware Superior Court.” For now, we’ll have to wait and see how this progresses further. title: Destiny 2 Equilibrium Dungeon Guide – Complete Walkthrough
content: Here’s our comprehensive guide on how to complete every encounter in the new Equilibrium dungeon in Destiny 2 . Equilibrium is Destiny 2’s newest 3-player dungeon, launched in the second week of Renegades , and it drops some exciting new rewards , including the Heirloom Exotic plus a full set of new dungeon weapons and armor. Story-wise, Equilibrium puts you alongside Aunor Mahal as you track down the acolytes of Dredgen Bael . The opening encounter takes place on Venus, but the following encounters are actually on the ship. If you’re trying to get in right away, make sure you actually have access: you need to purchase the Renegades expansion. Image: Bungie via The Game Post Related: Destiny 2 Equilibrium Loot Table: Dungeon Weapons and Armor In this guide, we’ll walk you through the whole dungeon, each and every mechanic you can find, and how to solve all the puzzles. We’ll keep the walkthrough simple: what to do, what usually causes wipes, and quick role callouts. Opening Encounter When you load into Equilibrium, you’ll spawn in the Temple Grounds with a simple first objective: clear the area . Right away, a wave of Cabal enemies will drop in. Wipe them out before you push forward. Nothing here is meant to be a hard fight, but it’s easy to get slowed down. There’s a yellow bar Cabal called “Imperium Generalis,” that spawns here. There will be a bunch of Cabal drop pods that will drop on each side, which will instant-kill you. So, stay clear of each side. Image: Bungie Once the area is clear, move forward until you see a waterfall ahead. Jump down and drop all the way to the bottom , then head forward into a tunnel . Inside the tunnel, you’ll run into a few Cabal War Beasts . Clear them quickly, then keep moving, since this section is mostly just a short run to the first real arena. Keep moving forward through the tunnel and follow the path until you come out the other side. As soon as you exit, the first encounter area will be directly in front of you . Image: Bungie First Encounter: Harvester This first encounter is Harvester . You start by interacting with the ship in the middle, then you’re basically juggling two things at once: keeping the arena under control while your team builds up Gathering Shadows so you can use Shadow Novice to break enemy shields and push the encounter forward. After the encounter kicks off, focus on clearing enemies , because the arena can get messy fast. During this, you’ll see red Nameless Apprentices show up. These are the ones that look like they’re about to explode, and they’re tied to the red doors around the arena. Image: Bungie Related: Destiny 2 Equilibrium The Way Between Quest: All Relic Locations, Puzzle Solutions, and How To Focus Loot When an Apprentice is close to detonating, you need to activate the arrays (Satellites) next to the matching red door . Bait the Nameless Apprentice to the array you, and activate it as the enemy explodes. It will destroy the array . Doing that opens the red barrier door and keeps your run moving. There are six Apprentices total , and once they’re dealt with, no more should spawn. Again, there will be a bunch of Cabal drop pods that can take you out instantly. So, make sure you keep moving. Image: Bungie Now use the Sparrows inside the side rooms, and that’s your key to building Gathering Shadows quickly. Hop on a Sparrow and run the short courses around the arena, grabbing the Taken wells as you go. Keep collecting until your Gathering Shadows meter is filled. Once it’s full, it’ll turn into Shadow Novice with a 45 second timer. Once you’re full, hit the Renegade ability button to swap into Shadow power . Go back in the middle area and use it to destroy the immune shields on enemies, then take them down. You can also refresh your Shadow Novice by picking it up from dead Gladiators , so don’t ignore those drops if your meter runs out mid-rotation. Image: Bungie To finish Harvester, you need to kill all remaining adds and also take down the Behemoth Walkers that show up. After collecting the loot, head to the ship in the middle and interact to board. It will take you to the main ship. Order of Operations Interact with the ship in the middle to begin Harvester. Clear immediate ads and keep moving. Watch for Cabal drop pods , since they can instang-kill you. Watch out for red Nameless Apprentice , move toward the array (satellite) next to red barrier door. Bait the Nameless Apprentice onto the array, then activate the array as it explodes . The explosion destroys the array and opens the red barrier door . Head into the opened side rooms and use the Sparrows inside to start building Gathering Shadows . Ride the course and collect Taken wells until Gathering Shadows is full. When full, it converts into Shadow Novice with a 45-second timer . Hit the Renegade ability button to activate the Shadow power using your Shadow Novice window. Return to the middle area, use Shadow power to break immune shields , then kill shielded targets and keep

title: Destiny 2 Equilibrium The Way Between Quest: All Relic Locations, Puzzle Solutions, and How To Focus Loot
content: Here’s our full step-by-step guide for Destiny 2 ’s Equilibrium dungeon quest “The Way Between,” including all four relic locations, puzzle solutions, how loot focusing works, and how to unlock the Heirloom catalyst. Equilibrium is Destiny 2’s newest dungeon, and if you’re here, you’ve probably already completed it once. It’s a three-player activity that leans hard into the Shadow mechanics you learn early on, which builds on in the later encounters. If you’re still working on the clears themselves, start with our complete Equilibrium dungeon walkthrough guide first , then come back here once you’re ready to chase the deeper rewards. Equilibrium also has a full dungeon loot pool, including the Exotic Heirloom , plus a full set of dungeon weapons and armor. If you want the full list of drops, roll potential, and which items exist at all, check our complete Equilibrium dungeon loot table . Image: Bungie via Breshi123 Related: Destiny 2 Equilibrium Loot Table: Dungeon Weapons and Armor Just like a lot of previous dungeons, Equilibrium also has its own questline: “The Way Between. ” It’s a 10-step quest that requires you to complete the dungeon multiple times, with hidden routes, secret fights, and four relics to find. In this guide, we’re going to walk you through how to complete The Way Between from start to finish, where every relic is, how each puzzle works, and what you need to do at the end to unlock loot focusing and get started on the Heirloom catalyst . How to complete The Way Between quest in the Equilibrium dungeon The Way Between is built around repeat clears. You do a normal clear, then new secret puzzles appear in the dungeon. You solve a puzzle, collect a relic, and then the quest requires you to complete the dungeon again. Each time you progress, the dungeon opens up more steps until you’ve collected all four relics and unlocked the final secret boss. The biggest thing to understand is that this quest is not meant to be finished in one casual run. It will take multiple clears to wrap it up, because the quest adds new objectives after you complete earlier ones. That said, there is a way to speed it up if you run with someone who is already ahead on the quest. We’ll share how this works below. Image: Bungie via Breshi123 What you unlock from this quest Completing The Way Between is worth it for two reasons. First, it unlocks the dungeon’s reward loop, including the ability to focus for specific Equilibrium loot instead of just hoping the right item shows up. Second, it’s tied to getting the Heirloom catalyst , which is something you’d really want to get. A huge part of the quest is also finding four hidden relics inside the dungeon. Each relic is tied to a puzzle path, and the final relic leads to a secret boss fight that acts like the quest’s real finish line. Now let’s get into it step-by-step. (thanks, Skarrow9 ) Image: Bungie via The Game Post The Way Between quest walkthrough Step 1 Visit Aunor Mahal. Pick up The Way Between from Aunor at the Tharsis Outpost before you jump into the dungeon. This is your “quest is active” step, and you want it done before you spend time on clears. Step 2 Complete the Equilibrium dungeon normally. Your first step is simply getting a full clear. No tricks, no puzzles, just finish the dungeon so the quest begins to open up the extra paths. After you defeat the final boss, Dredgen Sere, you’ll get a new item called Integrated Relic. This is the first of the four relics you need to find and place them at a specific place in the dungeon. Image: Bungie Step 3 After the first encounter, enter the Praxic Temple and place the relic. Once you beat the first encounter called Harvester, do not immediately push forward like a normal run and board the Harvester ship. Turn back and head into the Praxic temple area behind you, which opens up for the quest. Inside, you’ll place the relic into one of the slots. This will kick off the rest of the quest. You’ll get some dialogue from Aunor Mahal. Image: Bungie Image: Bungie Step 4 (Relic 1 and Puzzle 1) After placing the first relic, leave the temple, go left into the same zone that connects to the sparrow/pike section from earlier during the encounter. You’re looking for a Taken orb. Break that orb using the Praxic Blade, and it will create a Taken well . Get your whole team inside that puddle to start the secret encounter . Once the secret encounter starts, you’ll be fighting Taken and dealing with Eyes of Acolytes. Killing the eyes drops, Shadow energy wells, and standing in them is how you power up your Shadow energy, working your way toward Shadow Master. Image: Bungie There are also immune shielded Captains that show up during this, and the clean way through is to become Shadow Master and then use your special ability , like the Shadow attack, to break their shields so your team can kill them. Tip: If you have a friend who is ahead on the quest or has already finished it, run with them. When someone in the fireteam has alre

title: Destiny 2 Loot Tables: All Raids And Dungeons Gear
content: Discover comprehensive loot tables for all Destiny 2 raids and dungeons, detailing the exotic and legendary rewards players can earn from these challenging endgame activities. Destiny 2 offers an expansive universe filled with numerous activities for players to explore, but none are as challenging or rewarding as raids and dungeons. Raids in Destiny 2 are six-player cooperative missions that often span multiple encounters, each with unique mechanics and bosses. Dungeons, on the other hand, are typically three-player activities that offer a similar level of complexity and reward structure but on a smaller scale. They blend the difficulty of raids with the accessibility of smaller fireteams, providing a perfect middle ground for players who might not have a full team of six. Image: Bungie Both of these endgame activities offer a variety of unique rewards such as exotic weapons, legendary weapons, armor, and cosmetic items like emblems, Ghost shells, sparrows, and ships. If you’re looking for the complete list of Destiny 2 loot tables for all raids and dungeons, you’ve come to the right place. The complete list of all the Destiny 2 loot tables for raids and dungeons. Share your favorite raid and dungeon in Destiny 2 with us in the comments below!

title: Blizzard Needs to Make Diablo 4's Sanctification System Permanent
content: Season 11 is well underway, the holidays are here, leaderboards are coming soon, and there's a new expansion on the way. There's a lot to look forward to going into the new year for Diablo, but Sanctification is one system that hasn't been announced as a core feature going into the base game. If Blizzard wants to give players a richer itemization, build diversity, and endgame longevity, Sancification needs to stay going forward. Diablo 4's Itemization Problems Gear in Diablo 4 comes in three core flavors: Legendaries, Uniques, and Mythics, but realistically, there isn't much in terms of choice for these items, and the core changes to Tempering and Masterworking in Season have only made them less interesting by removing variance and individuality from gear. For any given build, there is a set of enabling uniques that must be used, full stop. As an example, Death Trap Rogues not equipping Scoundrel's Leathers or Eyes in the Dark would not just make the build worse, it would make the build entirely unplayable. These item slots are essentially "locked" for each build, with no alternatives available. Similarly, Mythics share the same fate. Items such as Harlequin Crest, Shroud of False Death, and Ring of Starless Skies have become staples of many builds, or in the case of Starless Skies, sometimes even build-enabling through the resource cost reduction. With Uniques and Mythics, it is normal, almost expected, that 4-5 item slots are pre-determined, locked in powers with no diversion. In terms of variance and inter-build diversity, gear progression, power-scaling, and even endgame grinds, that only leaves Legendaries to do the heavy lifting of the entire gear system. And yet, Legendaries suffer much the same fate as Uniques and Mythics, with aspects like Vehement Brawler's Aspect being required parts of builds as well. From top to bottom, Diablo 4's gearing is dictated and pre-determined not by gear, but by the guaranteed effects on them. Sanctification as a Solution to Diablo 4's Gearing This is where Sanctification comes in. With the numerous outcomes available to the system, double aspect items, sanctified affixes and more, item slots are no longer "finished" the moment a required piece of the puzzle drops. Gear with Sanctification is more individual, enables gear decisions if certain aspects or mythic powers are added, and gives players something to gamble and work towards. Chasing that perfect piece of gear is one of the great joys of any ARPG, and the base game without Sanctification doesn't have the itemization depth to enable that chase. For the good of the game, Sanctification has to become a core system starting with Season 12.

title: Introducing the Wowhead Architect Tool for Player Housing
content: Wowhead is happy to announce our newest Player Housing tool called Wowhead Architect -- a 3D Model viewer that allows you to import your house and customize it before committing to those changes in game! Wowhead Architect Alpha for Player Housing We recommend having Hardware Acceleration turned on when using the feature. Wowhead Architect Tool We're happy to announce our Wowhead Architect tool for Player Housing. This tool is currently in an Alpha state, and there are more features currently planned in the future. If you have any bugs, please let us know. Features You can use the Wowhead Architect tool to plan your house exactly how you want it, before making those changes in game. Don't forget that there are a lot more decor items coming in Midnight as well, and you can preview how those decor items will look in your house using our tool so when Midnight launches, you can know exactly what decor items you need and can quickly replicate it. There are many features currently available in the Wowhead Architect tool: An open sandbox Model Viewer - build a house to look exactly how you want it. Pick and place decor items - exactly like you would in game. Import your house - Move your decor around to where it looks best without doing permanent moves in game. Import a friends' house - For inspiration or to see what items they used and how things are set up. Preview dyes - To see what color matches your room perfectly before committing gold to it. Save and Load - Want to take a break? Save and load your house at a later time to continue working on it. Preview We recently previewed Hippo's house and we imported this into our Architect tool and have some preview screenshots below! Coming Soon There are more features planned including: House Import Selection - Currently we only import the first house for a character, but characters can have multiple different houses! We will add support to choose which house to import for the character. Additional Customizations - Customizing walls, ceilings, and floors is also on our list. We want to match what you can do in-game as much as we can. Support for Live - Currently, Wowhead Architect is only available on our Midnight Beta database. We definitely want to support it on Live as soon as we can, so you can see the decor available in-game right now. UI/UX Enhancements - We'll continue to polish this UI, fix any bugs or odd behaviors, and add things from in-game. For example, adding the tag support in the decor picker is on our list. In-Game Limits - Building a house in a sandbox is fun, but maybe you're trying to plan your in-game build. We plan to add support for decor/room weight counters and limits, and importing your in-game acquired decor list, as an option. And more! If there's any other features you'd like to see, please check out the comments below!

title: Legion Remix Ends January 19th - Buy Remaining Bronze Rewards and Finish Achievements
content: Blizzard has confirmed that Legion Remix will end on January 19th. Legion Remix: RewardsDecor Farming in Legion Remix Legion Remix Ends January 19th Legion Remix now has an confirmed end date of January 19th with many of the rewards and benefits of the event no longer being available. This infographic confirms that Legion Remix will end with the Midnight Pre-Patch alongside AoTC and CE achievement, the Keystone Legend achievement for Season 3, and PvP Gladiator achievements. There are many benefits and rewards in Legion Remix that you should consider farming before it goes away in a month! Leveling Speed You can level a fresh level 80 character super fast in Legion Remix, especially with stackable experience bonuses and the recent nerfs to experience needed from 70 to 80. Legion Remix Rewards Here are some of the highlights of the rewards that you probably want from the event before it goes away!: Legion Remix: Rewards Sargerei Transmogs: 4 unique transmog sets are exclusive to Legion Remix, and contains a very unique cape model in the game. The Fel Order Hall mounts: 12 fel version of the Order Hall mounts are available in Legion Remix. You can level up each class to get it for free, or you can buy them from the vendor for 20k Bronze. The Druid mount is also a new flight form. Unique mounts: 33 brand new remix mounts are available to add to your collection. From the Ilidari Dreadstalker to the Arcberry Manasaber, there are lots of mounts here to add to your stables. If you’re missing mounts from Legion, this is also a great time to get some rarer or unobtainable mounts like the Gul’dan Infernals or the Violet Spellwing, the old AOTC mount. Naxt Victim: This achievement is near impossible on live servers, but is much easier on Legion Remix with people farming the Sentinax. If you want this achievement, head over to the Sentinax now and click here for more details. Balance of Power: The Balance of Power quest chain is much easier in Legion Remix. Many of the timegating elements and odd quests have been removed, and you have an overpowered character for many of the steps. Don’t forget this achievement is Warband wide meaning you only need to do this once for all your characters. Hidden Artifact Appearances: If you’re missing some of the hidden artifact appearances, many of them are much easier. You can buy some directly off a vendor, special events like the Withered Army Training and Raid Bosses have a daily lockout and World bosses spawn much more frequently. Don’t forget that the first time you unlock a Hidden Artifact on a class, you get a decor item as well. Dungeon Portals: 5 of the Legion Mythic+ teleports are now available from Mythic+ dungeons. If you’ve wanted the ability to portal to Legion now is the time to get them as who knows if any of these dungeons will ever come back to Mythic+. Special Weapons:Many special weapons are much easier to get in Legion Remix such as Taeshalach and the Argus Scythes. Complete the Mythic raids twice and you’ll have enough to be the proud owner of your new weapons that look super cool!

title: Warlocks Can Now Unlock the Power of Fel Magic in Mists of Pandaria Classic
content: Warlocks, masters of the Fel, have long wanted a way to make their fire spells match the energies they harness and wield in combat. In the original release of Mists of Pandaria, a new questline was introduced to reward players with this unique customization. Isle of Thunder Zone Guide Much like the Benediction questline for Priests, or the Rhok'delar, Longbow of the Ancient Keepers challenges for Hunters back in Classic, the The Codex of Xerrath questline for Warlocks in Mists of Pandaria (now returning in Mists of Pandaria Classic) will challenge you to make full use of the Warlock class' kit and utility, and require quite a bit of skill (and a bit of luck) to succeed. Starting the quest You'll begin your quest by looting a Sealed Tome of the Lost Legion from rare mobs in the Isle of Thunder. The drop rate for the tome is relatively low, but with some persistence, you can score one eventually. If you're not inclined to grind, you may also find it at your local Auction House. Keep in mind that the tome is only lootable by Warlocks, and any Warlock that tags an Isle of Thunder rare can potentially loot it, but only one tome drops per rare, and only one Warlock will get it from that kill (the loot is pre-assigned, so it doesn't matter how fast you loot the corpse; only the assigned Warlock will be able to see it or loot it). Look for Jubeka's Mark at the entrance of the Black Temple to start the final Scenario. Once you obtain it, you should be able to follow the questline, which starts with An Unusual Tome. As you follow the chain (no spoilers here, sorry!), you will learn about the mysterious Council of the Black Harvest, and ultimately travel to the Black Temple, Illidan's former seat of power. The Solo Challenge The last quest, Infiltrating the Black Temple leads you to one of WoW's most memorable solo challenges: Kanrethad Ebonlocke. This encounter is more about proper execution than it is about raw item level, as Kanrethad has a lot of abilities that need to be reacted to, and proper use of your skills is required to succeed. "Say hello to my little friend!" While obviously a higher item level (closer to 522+ at least) will make the fight easier, it is definitely possible to complete it with an item level as low as 489 and even lower. It is advised that if you're trying this at a lower item level, to bring plenty of combat consumables (flasks, food, potions) and a few Purification Potions to deal with Kanrethad's Curse of Ultimate Doom if it comes to that (this is the fight's "enrage" timer). Power! Unlimited (Fel) Power As a reward for your efforts, once you defeat and banish the infamous Leader of the Black Harvest, you'll be able to learn The Codex of Xerrath, which has various cosmetic effects that are better experienced than spoiled. While the changes are more obvious to Destruction players (as they have more Fire spells), every specialization will see changes in its spells. Should you wish to go back to a life of non-green fire (and really, who would want that?), you'll find Jubeka Shadowbreaker in Shadowmoon Valley, where she can rid you of the Fel awesomeness burden for the low sum of . Should you wish to become awesome tainted by Fel magic again, simply interact with the banished Kanrethad. Did you defeat Kanrethad in the original Mists of Pandaria release or in MoP Classic? How many attempts did it take? Let us know in the comments down below!

title: AOTC and Cutting Edge Achievements Will Be Unavailable with Pre-Patch - What To Do Before the Midnight Pre-Patch
content: Blizzard has detailed everything going away with the Midnight Pre-Patch! While CE and AOTC achievements are being removed, the mount drop rates will not be lowered until Midnight launches on March 2nd The War Within storyline is winding down to its conclusion as we approach the beginning of World of Warcraft’s next chapter in Midnight. Before we turn the page on your next adventures, you’ll want to complete activities from around Khaz Algar before many of their rewards are no longer available when the pre-expansion content update goes live and The War Within Season Three ends on January 20. The War Within Season Three Raids The following Season Three rewards and achievements will no longer be attainable: Ahead of the Curve: Dimensius, the All-Devouring (Feat of Strength): Defeat Dimensius, the All-Devouring on Heroic difficulty or higher before the release of the next raid tier. Cutting Edge:Dimensius, the All-Devouring (Feat of Strength): Defeat Dimensius, the All-Devouring on Mythic difficulty before the release of the next raid tier. Upper Left: Royal Voidwing Lower Right: Unbound Star-Eater While the Royal Voidwing and Unbound Star-Eater mounts won’t be going away with the pre-expansion content update, the Royal Voidwing earned from completing the quest “A Twilight Oath’s End” will no longer be earnable with the launch of Midnight on March 2. The drop chance of the Unbound Star-Eater and other Mythic Raid mounts will decrease significantly with Midnight's launch. Mythic+ The Mythic+ leaderboards will lock at 10:00 pm PST the night before maintenance in each region—January 19 at 10:00 pm PST for NA / January 20 at 22:00 CET for EU. With the season’s end, ratings that qualify for the 0.1% “the Unbound Hero” title and achievement will be recorded. The title will be rewarded in the following weeks after the season ends. PvP Astral Gladiator's Fel Bat The current season of PvP content will end at 10:00 pm PST the night before maintenance in each region—January 19 at 10:00 pm PST for NA / January 20 at 22:00 CET for EU. With the season’s end, it will no longer be possible to earn PvP seasonal rewards, titles, or The War Within Season Three rankings, and titles will be awarded in the weeks after the season ends: Astral Gladiator: The War Within Season 3 (Feat of Strength): End The War Within Season 3 in the top 0.1% of the 3v3 arena ladder (requires 150 games won in The War Within Season 3). Rewards the title “Astral Gladiator”. Astral Legend: The War Within Season 3 (Feat of Strength): End The War Within Season 3 in the top 0.1% of the Solo Shuffle ladder. Players can still queue for rated PvP modes for Honor, Conquest, and progress toward the faction-themed Vicious Void Creeper mount for Horde or Alliance. The following rated PvP rewards can only be earned during The War Within Season Three and will no longer be available once the season ends: Astral Gladiator’s Fel Bat mount: "Awakened from caves in the battlefield, and armored to the fray.” Arcane Weapon Illusion The War Within Season Three PvP Elite Weapon and Transmog Set Titles: Combatant: Get a 1000 Rating Challenger: Get a 1400 Rating Rival: Get a 1800 Rating Duelist: Get a 2100 Rating Gladiator: 50 wins at 2400 Rating Complete Legion Remix Before January 20 Glide into fast frenetic fun in Legion Remix as you meet up with the infinite dragonflight once more, level new characters, and earn a variety of items to add to your collection. As the Legion Remix timeline begins collapsing, say your goodbyes and embrace the chaos. Learn more in our previously published article. World of Warcraft®: Midnight™ launching worldwide on March 2, 2026, at 3:00 pm PST. Players who have purchased any edition of the Midnight expansion can secure Housing Early Access now!

title: Corruption of the Aspects - Twelve Days of Mounts: Day 4
content: Welcome to day four of our special Twelve Days of Mounts series, 2025 edition! With the year coming to a close, we are doing a series of highlights on remarkable or easy-to-collect mounts added in 2025. Today's highlight is the Corruption of the Aspects! The War Within Mount Guide Corruption of the Aspects Corruption of the Aspects is an easy mount to collect from Revisited Horrific Visions. It is sold by Torie, the Revisited Horrific Visions quartermaster in Dornogal, for 40,000 Displaced Corrupted Mementos. Note that you must complete the achievement We Have the Memories before being able to purchase it. Horrific Visions Revisited Horrific Visions returned in Patch 11.1.5, with a new set of cosmetics to unlock. To enter these new visions, you must head to Dornogal, next to the Coreway: Horrific Visions Hub If you're soloing this, you'll need to progress through Visions to unlock its tech tree. If you haven't, you can learn about that process here. After unlocking the whole tech tree, the only thing left is to farm Corrupted Mementos to purchase your mount, which will take you a few extra Horrific Visions runs, depending on how many Masks you're running. More Masks will award you with more Mementos, but will make the runs more deadly and dangerous. However, with Season 3 gearing, it shouldn't be too bad. Visions offer a plethora of pets, toys, and mounts besides the Corruption of the Aspects. title: Blizzard, Where Is The Festive Housing Decor?
content: The Holidays are fast approaching, and decorations have gone up all around the world. For player housing, however, the Winter Veil Tree is missing. With the Winter Veil Tree datamined weeks ago, it stood to reason that holiday decor would become available before Christmas, but that doesn't seem to be the case anymore. Christmas is just a few days away, Winter Veil is well underway in-game, but it remains unknown how to obtain the special tree. Festive holiday decor would be a great addition to player housing. It could be used to celebrate everything from birthdays with special cakes to Christmas or even more regional holidays, such as the 4th of July, which could have outdoor fireworks. At the end of the day, if festive decorations are going to work, Blizzard needs to give players their decorations in advance, rather than after the fact, when all the festivities are already over. Where is the Winter Veil Tree? The most likely source for the tree is as a present under Greatfather Winter's tree, which can be opened starting December 25th. This does however make for a bit of an awkward timing, as players would be receiving holiday decorations after the holidays. Some more outlandish ideas for the tree's drop source include it being part of the endeavour system or being added to a vendor via a hotfix, both of which seem unlikely given that Winter Veil Tree is named after Winter Veil. Getting Creative for Christmas Players instead have resorted to making their own trees, such as Reddit User Lexiconn, who spent a whole afternoon setting up a massive tree in their main room. Lexiconn made sure to include all the details in their tree, including presents! Sadly for players that aren't willing to spend hours making a tree from scratch, Blizzard has provided very little in the way of information regarding the Winter Veil Tree decor item.

title: Salvaged Goblin Gazillionaire's Flying Machine - Twelve Days of Mounts: Day 3
content: Welcome to day three of our special Twelve Days of Mounts series, 2025 edition! With the year coming to a close, we are doing a series of highlights on remarkable or easy-to-collect mounts added in 2025. Today's highlight is the Salvaged Goblin Gazillionaire's Flying Machine! The War Within Mount Guide Salvaged Goblin Gazillionaire's Flying Machine Salvaged Goblin Gazillionaire's Flying Machine is a rare drop from the Gallagio Garbage rare spawn in Undermine. This rare has a chance to spawn during S.C.R.A.P. jobs in Undermine, namely when the job hits 500/500 tracking. Scrap Jobs Scrap digging is an activity unlocked in Undermine, starting with Renown 3 with the Cartels of Undermine. Note that you don't need to unlock it to obtain this mount, as it is a drop for the rare. You need to unlock it to help summon the rare, however. Once you go through the tutorial quest, you can start doing S.C.R.A.P. Jobs in Undermine. To locate them, look at the Undermine world map for trash icons. Once you find one, head to the area and speak with the NPC in the area, Carlo Greasegrind, to start a job. Once a job starts, you have 2 minutes to dig through as much trash as possible! Digging trash will give you a new currency, Empty Kaja'Cola Can. As you dig, you will face enemies that will distract you and require killing, hazards that require dodging or kicking, and more. While farming for this mount, you'll likely earn many Empty Kaja'Cola Can from doing the scrap digs. These can be traded with Angelo Rustbin at the Undermine Sanitation building in Hovel Hill for other items like toys or pets, or even for a bag that has a chance of containing a mount. You can learn more in our Scrap Digging guide. Day 1: Personalized Goblin S.C.R.A.P.per Day 2: Darkfuse Spy-Eye Day 3: Gazillionaires Flying Machine Day 4: Corruption of the Aspects Day 5: ? Day 6: ? title: Even More Buffs Coming to Arms Warrior on China's Titan Reforged Server
content: Blizzard and NetEase have announced additional changes to Arms Warrior on China's Titan Reforged server. These changes are intended to improve the attack speed scaling and overall damage output for Arms Warriors. Restoration Druid Healing Buffs Massive Buffs to Arms Warrior After the weekly maintenance on December 25, we will be making the following adjustments to Arms Warriors on the Titan Reforged server: Time: Warrior Changes Arms: Wrecking Crew Damage bonus increased to 4/8/12/16/20% (up from 3/6/9/12/15%) Blood Frenzy Attack speed bonus increased to 10/20% (up from 5/10%) Bladestorm Now deals 115% weapon damage (down from 125%) Can now hit up to 6 targets Deals 30% additional damage to the nearest target. This results in a total of 149.5% weapon damage to the nearest target Developer’s Notes: The goal of these changes is to improve attack speed scaling and overall damage output for Arms Warriors, while also giving Bladestorm greater flexibility so it can effectively serve both single-target and multi-target scenarios. To achieve this, we increased Bladestorm’s target cap while slightly reducing its base damage coefficient, and introduced a key new mechanic: Bladestorm now deals additional damage to the nearest target. With these adjustments, Bladestorm should feel more impactful in both single-target and AoE combat, without becoming overly dominant in multi-target situations. It also introduces an interesting positional decision for the Warriors—standing closer to a priority target to deal increased damage. "For the Burning Blade!"

title: New Training Grounds Quest Drops Hero-Track Jewelry in Midnight
content: A new PvP quest for the PvP Training Grounds in Midnight will drop a piece of Hero-track Jewelry of the player's choice! Early Morning Training Quest The quest requires players to complete 3 Battlegrounds matches. These matches can be completed in the new Training Grounds playlist, which features PvP combat against AI-bots instead of real players. Taking inspiration from Comp Stomp, Training Grounds gives players a smoother introduction to WoW PvP. If players are not interested in playing against bots, they can also complete the quest against real players. The reward for completing this quest is the player's choice of a ring or necklace at item level 259 on the Hero-track. For gearing purposes, this quest becomes extremely valuable, considering players don't need to complete PvP matches against real players.

title: Earn Powerful Rewards with Diablo 4's New Hidden Boss Fight
content: Diablo 4 Season 11 has been hiding a secret from everyone: a new boss fight that is only accessible through a set of altars throughout Sanctuary. Dropping rewards that include a Resplendent Spark, this is something players will definitely want to do at some point! Purified Essences and Altars In Diablo 4 Season 11 To activate the boss fight, players will need to bring a set of purified essences to the corresponding altars. For example, the Purified Horn of Duriel drops from both the lair boss Duriel encounter as well as the new helltide boss version of Duriel. This must be turned in to the Altar of Pain, located in Kehjistan. The full list of altars and their essences is as follows: Altar of Pain Located in Kehjistan to the northwest of the Deshar Waypoint. The Altar of Pain is where players can turn in the Purified Horn of Duriel. Altar of Lies Located in Fractured Peak to the east of the Bear Tribe Refuge Waypoint, the Altar of Lies is where players can turn in the Purified Eye of Belial. Altar of Anguish Located in Nahantu to the southwest of the Kurast Docks Waypoint, the Altar of Anguish is where players can turn in the Purified Claw of Andariel. Altar of Sin Located in Hawezar between Zarbinzet and the Ruins of Rakhat Keep, the Altar of Sins is where players can turn in the Purified Tongue of Azmodan. Hidden Boss Fight and Rewards After turning in the purified essences to all four altars, a portal will open, taking you to the special boss encounter with the lesser evils. Defeating them drops the following loot: One Resplendent Spark One Tribute of Ascendance Various Assorted Runes A large amount of Uniques The Shield Crest of Exile mount trophy cosmetic

title: The Pre-Nerf or Post-Nerf Debate - How Difficult Should It Be to Raid in Classic?
content: Blizzard recently announced that they would be looking into whether or not they will release raids post-Tier 4 in their pre-nerf state. At the beginning of PTR testing, Blizzard announced that their initial plan was for all raids to go live post-nerf, sparking a large debate among the community about whether or not this was the right decision. Post-Nerf Difficutly Under Discussion Some players want to see the raids in their original iteration, while others welcome raids being more forgiving and easier overall. In this article, we'll not only go over the pros and cons of both pre- and post-nerf raids in TBC Classic, but also look into the future of Classic WoW's raiding scene. The Difference Between Pre-Nerf and Post-Nerf The Pre-Nerf state of a raid refers to the original difficulty of the raid. While Post-Nerf refers to the state of the raid after receiving changes that reduced its overall difficulty. One example players have seen on the PTR with Tier 4 raids includes Nightbane from Karazhan, dealing significantly less melee damage to the tank, while his intermission phase also drastically reduces the health of his Restless Skeleton adds and damage from his Searing Cinders debuff. Nerfs to Tier 4 and 5 TBC Raids Other changes to encounters include Gruul's Shatter ability doing significantly less damage should players fail the mechanic, or Magtheridon's infamous Manticron Cubes not applying the debuff that prevents players from interacting with the cube again. Across the board, nearly all bosses also receive health and damage reductions, making all these encounters significantly easier to overcome. Players testing on the PTR have been able to overcome many of these encounters, even with several members of the raid dead, missing healers, or accidental pulls when everyone in the raid was not ready. Magheridon and the "Pug Breaking" Manticron Cubes Common sentiment among players is that Tier 4 raids are already relatively easy, even in their pre-nerf state. However, going into Tier 5 raiding with Tempest Keep and Serpentshrine Cavern, a Tier where raid difficulty exponentially ramps up, especially with encounters like Lady Vashj, this begs the question: "Should TBC Anniversary move forward with Post-Nerf raids, or look to revert their decision?" The Pros and Cons of Post-Nerf Raids Benefits of Post-Nerf Raids There are several factors that should be considered when discussing PvE content difficulty in Classic WoW. In regards to the Anniversary servers, the biggest factor to consider is that these servers may be on an accelerated release cadence, meaning that players won't have as much time as they did back in 2006 or 2021 to complete the raids. In a post-Nerf state, raids would be easier, and players would, theoretically, be able to defeat more bosses and earn more loot in a shorter timeframe. Another aspect to consider is what Blizzard wants from these servers. Are these Anniversary servers meant to be a trip back to 2006, for players to experience the content as it was back then? Or is this just more of a "let's go back and relive some memories with our friends" situation, where Blizzard simply wants people to log in and have fun, engaging in "soda and pretzel" content? In regards to the original Classic progression servers, which are now on Mists of Pandaria, the player population has changed dramatically since Classic launch in 2019. However, there is a notable pattern of player drop-off when more difficult content is released. Via Ironforge.pro, we can see a drop off during Phase 2 of TBC Classic with the release of Tempest Keep and Serpentshrine Cavern, and an even bigger drop off during progression of Phase 2 of Wrath of the Lich King Classic, with the Ulduar raid. The boxed sections highlight player dropoff during Phase 2 of TBC (left) and Phase 2 of WoTLK (right) Should Blizzard want to keep a stable playerbase throughout all of TBC Anniversary, they might think that keeping the raids at a relatively easy state, to encourage more PUG (pick-up-group) raids to exist. Maybe with easier raids, we can see more Trade-Chat PUG groups successfully clearing the raid, eliminating the requirement of needing a locked-in guild raid night for players who may not have a consistent gaming schedule. Negatives of Pre-Nerf Raids On the other hand, there are also several factors to consider about The Burning Crusades Raids at their original difficulty. One question a player should ask themselves is: "Are these raids really that hard?" Looking at Tier 4 raids, should it really be that hard to organize players to be able to click the cubes correctly on Magtheridon? Is it really too difficult for players to be able to spread out properly on Gruul to prevent dying to his Stoned and Shatter mechanics? Many challenges back in the original TBC came from the lack of resources we have now. Getting 25 players on Ventrilo (the original Discord) to communicate during an encounter wasn't as easy as it is now. Having access to fully f

title: Midnight Pre-Patch Vendor Rewards - Silvermoon Decor, Catch-up Gear, and More
content: Midnight's pre-patch event in the Twilight Highlands comes with a number of limited-time rewards, including Silvermoon-themed housing decor, Twilight cultist transmog items, and catch-up gear for alts! title: New House Levels and Rewards Datamined - Increased Decor Budgets and Medium-Size Exteriors
content: With Housing being all the craze on live servers right now, it seems that Blizzard isn't quite done with its features for Midnight. We've datamined brand-new Housing levels, with rewards that expand decor budgets and introduce new medium-size house exteriors! New House Level Rewards Level: NEW 7 Name: Room and Decor Placement Budget Bonuses Description: Gain an additional 10 Room Placement Budget and 500 Decor Placement Budget at this level. Level: NEW 8 Name: Medium-Size House Exteriors Description: You may now use medium-size house exteriors for your house. Level: NEW 9 Name: Room and Decor Placement Budget Bonuses Description: Gain an additional 10 Room Placement Budget and 500 Decor Placement Budget at this level. What does this mean? First, it means that Blizzard is still actively tweaking Housing for its actual launch with Midnight. These new rewards mean expanded possibilities for interiors while hinting at changes coming for exteriors, as we hadn't heard of medium-size house exteriors until now. This change might mean new exterior-exclusive decor or options to make decor larger when used in exteriors, meaning you wouldn't need to use all your budget in rocks when building a cave, for instance. However, this is pure speculation.

content: Blizzard has added new titles to professions in Midnight. Completing two achievements per profession will unlock a new Thalassian profession title for your characters. Thalassian Profession Titles in Midnight Each profession has a title in Midnight, all formatted "Thalassian x". To earn these titles, you must complete each profession's Dedicated to Craft achievement, for instance: The achievement requires you to reach max level in that profession for their Midnight category and complete 50 crafting orders, or 4 profession weekly quests for gathering, for that profession. For instance, Dedicated to the Craft: Inscription requires you to complete Inscribing at Midnight and Inscription-on-Demand.

title: Platinum Challenge Mode Season 2 Rewards - Mists of Pandaria Classic
content: If you found that Challenge Modes weren't quite challenging enough when MoP Classic launched, you might enjoy the updates that came with Phase 3. While there was no actual increase in difficulty, there are now rewards for completing the Challenge Modes in even faster times than Gold. Challenge Mode Rewards Guide Platinum Achievements & Toys Before you say "an achievement isn't really a reward", let's just clarify that the achievements come with a toy. If you complete the Temple of the Jade Serpent Challenge Mode dungeon in Platinum time, you will earn the Temple of the Jade Serpent: Platinum achievement, which also comes with the Platinum Boots of Expeditious Retreat toy. Dungeon Achievement Toy Temple of the Jade Serpent: Platinum Platinum Boots of Expeditious Retreat Stormstout Brewery: Platinum Platinum "Little Ale" Gate of the Setting Sun: Platinum Platinum Rod of Ambershaping Shado-Pan Monastery: Platinum Platinum Potion of Invisibility Siege of Niuzao Temple: Platinum Platinum Amber Mogu'shan Palace: Platinum Platinum Battle Horn Scholomance: Platinum Platinum Vial of Polyformic Acid Scarlet Halls: Platinum Platinum Battle Banner Scarlet Monastery: Platinum Platinum Sacrificial Dagger Each dungeon rewards its own unique toy, and these toys can only be used inside Challenge Mode dungeons. Most of these toys are versions of commonly used items in Challenge Modes, such as the rocket boots linked above, or the Platinum Potion of Invisibility. Platinum Coins: Mounts, Pets, Toys, & Transmog In addition to an achievement, completing a Challenge Mode dungeon in Platinum time will earn you 3 Platinum Coins. Important to note, you earn coins every time you complete a dungeon in Platinum time, not just the first time. Item Type Price Eye of the Legion Pet 5 Platinum Coins Instant Statue Pedestal Toy 5 Platinum Coins Demon Hunter's Aspect Toy 5 Platinum Coins Swift Yak Pelt Toy 0 Platinum Coins Reins of the Ashen Pandaren Phoenix Mount 0 Platinum Coins Reins of the Crimson Pandaren Phoenix Mount 0 Platinum Coins Reins of the Violet Pandaren Phoenix Mount 0 Platinum Coins Reins of the Emerald Pandaren Phoenix Mount 0 Platinum Coins Magic Rooster Egg Mount 0 Platinum Coins Wooly White Rhino Mount 0 Platinum Coins Tabard of Brilliance Tabard 0 Platinum Coins Tabard of the Void Tabard 0 Platinum Coins Tabard of Fury Tabard 0 Platinum Coins Recolored Challenge Mode Pieces Transmog 5 Platinum Coins Per Piece 0 Platinum Coins Full Set These coins can then be used to buy mounts, tabards, toys, a pet, and recolored versions of the original Gold Challenge Mode sets. The mounts consist of two previously TCG-exclusive mounts, the Magic Rooster Egg and Wooly White Rhino, as well as all of the Silver Challenge Mode Phoenix mounts. The tabards, toys, and pets are also all previously TCG-exclusive items. Jaelof Ironhart To purchase all items you will need 465 coins (only counting 3 Phoenix mounts, since you will have earned one of them from the Silver achievement, and only one recolored transmog set), which means you would need to complete 155 Challenge Mode dungeons in Platinum time. Viktor Felhallow Alliance NPC on the top, Horde NPC on the bottom. The vendors are located in the faction Shrines, and they are Jaelof Ironhart for Alliance players, and Viktor Felhallow for the Horde. They are on the upper levels of the Shrines. Season 2 Rewards In addition to these Platinum awards, there will be rewards for players who complete all Challenge Mode dungeons in an "exceptionally fast time". While similar to arena titles, for example, this will not be a percentage of players, but rather a set time for each dungeon. The times have not yet been announced, but the reward will be the Mistborne achievement, which comes with the title, and the Reins of the Black Kor'kron Proto-drake mount. Please note, in the database the achievement currently lists the Reins of the Celestial Riding Serpent as the mount reward, but in a recent news post it was announced that it has been replaced by the Reins of the Black Kor'kron Proto-drake. The mount is a previously unavailable recolor of the Reins of Galakras. Do these updates and new rewards make you more interested in Challenge Mode dungeons? Is there a specific item that you have your eyes on? Let us know in the comments down below!

title: The Story of Vereesa Windrunner - Midnight Character Spotlight
content: Vereesa Windrunner finally returns to the story in the lead-up to Midnight -- but why? Here, we recap her storied history and speculate on what role the lesser known Windrunner might play in the upcoming expansion. Early Life Despite her role of lesser prominence compared to her sisters, Vereesa was one of Warcraft's earliest major characters, and the original Windrunner to appear by name in the franchise's first novel Day of the Dragon. Before she became the ranger we know today, however, Vereesa was merely the youngest of three sisters in the Windrunner family. In contrast to her headstrong older sisters, Vereesa was known as the peacekeeper of the family, soothing arguments not only between Sylvanas, Alleria, and their youngest brother Lirath, but those between Alleria and their mother, the Ranger-General of Quel'thalas Lireesa, as well. In time, Vereesa would follow in the footsteps of her sisters to become a member of the Farstriders, close to the onset of the Second War. Windrunner Spire in Midnight. Eventually, the arguments between Alleria and their mother boiled over when Alleria chose to leave behind Quel'thalas and abdicate her inheritance as Ranger-General to Sylvanas. Not long after, during the early days of the Second War, the first tragedy would strike the Windrunner family when news reached the siblings that their parents had been killed in an ambush by orcs and trolls. While Alleria turned to bloodlust towards the Horde and Sylvanas took up the mantle of Ranger-General, Vereesa was tasked with watching over Lirath, and began to train him to defend himself in secret. When the proper war reached Quel'thalas, Vereesa was among its defenders, rallying with her sisters and the newly formed Alliance of Lordaeron to fend off the Orcish Horde. Vereesa and Sylvanas returned home, however, to find yet more tragedy -- Lirath, dead at the hands of the orcs. When Sylvanas learned that it was Vereesa's training that had given Lirath the confidence to engage in battle, a rift formed between the two sisters. Vereesa would continue to serve the Farstriders, but far away from Sylvanas and her duties in Quel'thalas. In time, the Orcish Horde was defeated, and their remnants fled back through the Dark Portal to find other worlds to conquer. Unwilling to let the orcs go unpunished, Alleria volunteered as one of the leaders of the expedition to follow through the portal, and was forced to leave her son Arator behind in Vereesa's care. Along with the responsibility to raise Arator, Vereesa also recieved a ruby necklace from Alleria; one of a trio, with the other two held by Alleria and Sylvanas. While Alleria would eventually be lost behind the closed Dark Portal and was considered missing, the remaining two sisters held onto the necklaces to represent their bond despite the rifts of space and tragedy alike that had formed between them. Rhonin: Day of the Dragon In the wake of the Second War, Vereesa continued her work as a Farstrider, and desired to hunt down the remaining orcs not locked away in internment camps. Instead, Vereesa was instead assigned as escort to a fledgling mage named Rhonin. Despite her initial distaste for the human, Vereesa grew fond of Rhonin in the wake of a sudden attack by the Dragonmaw orcs and their red dragon mounts, and aided him on his mission to Khaz Modan. While she initially thought she had been assigned on a rather routine observation mission with Rhonin, she would later learn that Rhonin had been tasked by the red dragon Korialstrasz to aid him in freeing the Dragon Queen Alexstrasza and her clutch of red dragons from captivity under the Dragonmaw orcs. On their journey, they join forces with the Wildhammer dwarf Falstad, and were nearly killed by a dragon ambush... before being saved by Deathwing. The black dragon Aspect was not interested in their salvation, unfortunately, and used the opportunity to kidnap Rhonin to prevent him from freeing Alexstrasza. He had plans for the eggs being coveted by the Dragonmaw, and had granted them the means of subjugating Alexstrasza in the first place through use of the Demon Soul, a relic created by Deathwing with the combined power of the other Dragon Aspects. Now, he wished to claim the eggs from the Dragonmaw by force, sparing neither orc nor dragon as he attacked their citadel of Grim Batol. Vereesa and Falstad would later find Rhonin and free him, using the mage's newfound knowledge of the situation to sneak into Grim Batol as the battle with Deathwing waged. Inside, Alexstrasza managed to break free of her chains, rallying the other Aspects to her side and engaging in battle with Deathwing. While their initial attacks were of little effect, Rhonin was able to turn the tide when he used one of Deathwing's own scales to destroy the Demon Soul, returning the power held within to the Aspects and allowing them to chase their former brother off. As reward for their actions, Rhonin and Vereesa were held as friends of high regard to the Dra

title: Best Infinite Power Farms in Legion Remix - Empower Your Timerunner
content: With Legion Remix wrapping up after the holidays, let's take a look at some of the best ways to give your timerunner that extra oomph before the timeways collapse. Sentinax Farms Similar to Bronze Farms, Sentinax continues to reign supreme for raw Infinite Power grinds. Its main benefit being a farm that anyone can participate regardless of gear level. You can check our highlight in this standalone article, but the idea is to concentrate one group (ideally more) under the Sentinax and spam all its portals. You should use the group finder to find others interested in this farm, as there are usually a couple happening at all times. Note that, while rewarding, it can be a very boring farm. However, a good farm if you want to catch up on your favorite show or want to watch a new movie. Daily Raid Runs The og Infinite Power farm. While not a "farm" in the strict sense, it is still worthwhile to do. Farming raids daily has been a staple of Legion Remix, and it still rewards a plethora of Infinite Power every day, both from raw drops and from gathering 100s of Fragmented Memento of Epoch Challenges. While you can run each Legion raid once a day in each difficulty, for Infinite Power purposes, most players will stick with doing only Heroic and Mythic or only Mythic, as the gains reduce significantly on lower difficulties. Once again, Group Finder is your friend. There are hundreds of players running Legion raids daily, so even if you don't have the best geared character, you might be able to sneak into a run for Mythic raids. Mythic+ If you have a group of 3 to 5, Mythic+ might be the best way to farm for you. The idea here is to run lower keys that any of you can solo quickly and split-run them to complete it even faster. For instance, if you can solo +40, maybe try +30s for speed. The goal is to accumulate as many Fragmented Memento of Epoch Challenges as fast as you can from these keys. Remember to drop your key after each dungeon to keep the speedrun train going. The best keys for this method are keys like Eye of Azshara or Arcway that allow players to do bosses in any order, while keys like Darkheart Thicket or Neltharion's Lair don't really benefit from bringing more players along due to their linear design.

title: Majority of Addon Changes Finalized for Midnight Pre-Patch - Whitelisted Spells Detailed
content: Following up on the intent to loosen API restrictions shared earlier this week, Blizzard has released a list of whitelisted spells and API changes for the Midnight pre-patch, noting that the majority of future addon changes will be going into Patch 12.0.1 instead. These newly whitelisted spells are broken into two categories, with some being flagged to show just their cooldowns and others having all of their data visible. While all players can benefit from more easily customizing their Dragonriding ability's shared cooldowns, the change to Maelstrom Weapon and Void Metamorphosis information fills a critical informational hole for those specialization. These changes allow addons to track Maelstrom charges, a crucial aspect to playing Enhancement Shaman that isn't well supported by native tools. The other critical piece of information in this release is that the majority of future addon changes beyond those outlined below will be going into Patch 12.0.1, which launches a few weeks after the Pre-Patch. This means that players may need to find some creative solutions for issues not yet addressed as they re-customize their user interface, though the pre-patch is generally the best time for this transition, as players are also adjusting to other class, spec, and game-wide changes. Blizzard again! This week the first PTR build (PTR 1) for Midnight went up. As mentioned before, PTR is now 12.0.0 and all remaining Beta builds are 12.0.1. Below are the changes that are in PTR 1 that were not in Beta 5. It's important to note that ALL changes in PTR builds will also be in Beta, so expect to see these changes in Beta 6 as well when that goes up in January. After this build the majority of our addon changes will be going into 12.0.1 instead of 12.0.0 (we are very close to RC for 12.0.0) but there will be a few things that do go into 12.0.0 as well (mostly very high priority things). New Changes in PTR 1 (will also be in Beta 6) Whitelisting Select Spells The following spells have been flagged as having non-secret cooldowns: 425782 - Second Wind 372608 - Surge Forward 372610 - Skyward Ascent 403092 - Aerial Halt 361584 - Whirling Surge 418592 - Lightning Rush 460002 - Switch Flight Style 61304 - GCD Dummy Spell The following spells have been flagged as having non-secret aura data: 377234 - Thrill of the Skies 388367 - Ohn'ahra's Gusts 418590 - Static Charge 369968 - Skyriding Racing 344179 - Maelstrom Weapon 1217607 - Void Metamorphosis 1225789 - Void Metamorphosis (resource aura) 1227702 - Collapsing Star Combat Res Cooldowns All combat res spells now have non-secret cooldowns and charge counts. Reload UI & Secrets We have fixed an issue where secret values were made non-secret following a reload ui. Removing Old Duration APIs We have removed the follow APIs (addons should use the new Duration Object type instead from now on): C_ActionBar.GetActionCooldownRemaining, C_ActionBar.GetActionCooldownRemainingPercent C_Spell.GetSpellCooldownRemaining, C_Spell.GetSpellCooldownRemainingPercent C_UnitAuras.GetAuraDurationRemaining, C_UnitAuras.GetAuraDurationRemainingPercent Duration Object Utilities Added 2 new APIs to Duration Bbjects: EvaluateRemainingDuration(curve, modifier), EvaluateElapsedDuration(curve, modifier) Generic Boolean To Color APIs Added 2 new APIs (C_CurveUtil.EvaluateColorFromBoolean and C_CurveUtil.EvaluateColorValueFromBoolean) that can be used to convert a secret boolean to a color.

title: What's New With Celestial Dungeons in Mists of Pandaria Classic Phase 3
content: Mists of Pandaria Classic Phase 3 is firmly upon us, and that means the second season of Celestial Dungeons is now underway! In keeping with the Phase theme this season, you can expect to find your Celestial Dungeons influenced by Lei-Shen, but never fear, your buffs have been buffed to help you combat this. Celestial Dungeon Guide New Player Blessings BuffEffect Blessing of Yu'lon Your Intellect is increased by 15%. Your Stamina is increased by 5%. Damaging spells and abilities inflict Jadefire, burning the target for 15000 over 10 sec and increasing their magic damage taken by 3%. This can occur once every 4 seconds and can stack up to 5 times. And in Phase 3, an avatar of Yu'lon will breathe Jadefire on nearby enemies and amplify all Magic damage done by players for a short duration Blessing of Niuzao Your Stamina is increased by 20%. Your Strength, Agility, and Intellect are increased by 10%. Dodge, Parry, and Blocks increase your Stamina by 6% and your Strength, Agility, and Intellect by 4%. This effect lasts 20 seconds and can stack up to 20 times. And in Phase 3, an avatar of Niuzao will cause an earthquake, repeatedly stunning nearby enemies and increasing all Physical damage they take for a short duration. Blessing of Chi-JiYour Intellect and Stamina is increased by 10%. Healing spells and abilities recite a blazing song around your ally that increases their Movement Speed by 50%, heals nearby allies for 30000, and burns nearby enemies for 30000 Fire damage every 2 seconds for 15 sec. This can occur once every 30 seconds. And in Phase 3, an avatar will bestow a weakened version of Blazing Song to all allies. Blessing of Xuen Your Strength and Agility are increased by 15%. Direct attacks unleash an echo of Xuen's ferocity. A bolt of lightning is hurled at the enemy, dealing 20,000 Nature Damage, and then jumps to nearby enemies. This can occur once every 3 seconds. And in Phase 3, an avatar of Xuen will create a lightning vortex at its location, pulling all nearby enemies to its location and granting all allies a weakened version of Spectral Ferocity. Additional Boss Abilities Might of the Thunder King Enemies in the Celestial Dungeons will have the following buffs. Damage increased by 35% Health increased by 125% Lightning Traps: Players will need to avoid cycling lightning traps throughout the dungeons. Thunderstorms: All dungeons will experience new weather as a powerful thunderstorm takes over. Summon the Storm: Every 60 seconds, a boss is influenced by Lei Shen, the Thunder King, and will use one of the 3 new lightning-based abilities. Our full Celestial Dungeon guide has now been updated for Season 2, with new vendor details and item costs. Are you having fun running Celestial Dungeons this Phase? title: Unobtainable Legion Pre-Patch Achievement Returns for Remix - It All Makes Sense Now
content: Missed out on the original Legion Pre-Patch events? With the return of capital city Doomsayers in Legion Remix, Timerunners can acquire the previously unobtainable It All Makes Sense Now achievement once again. Legion Remix OverviewLegion Remix: Rewards It All Makes Sense Now Doomsayer Achievement Returns Previously only available during the Legion expansion, the limited-time It All Makes Sense Now pre-patch feat of strength is once again obtainable on Legion Remix but only for the remainder of the event. title: Will 2026 Be Blizzard's Biggest Year? Variety Interview With Blizzard President Johanna Faries
content: With their 35th anniversary coming up, 2026 is set to be a big year for Blizzard Entertainment. One way that Blizzard is planning on celebrating this milestone is through the return of BlizzCon in September. Earlier this week, Variety sat down with Blizzard's President, Johanna Faries, to discuss why players should be excited about what's next. Johanna Faries Interview With Variety Johanna Faries The teams across Blizzard entirely, as an organization, are gearing up for what we hope to be the biggest year yet for Blizzard, and we take that statement very seriously. Diablo During the Game Awards, Blizzard announced the latest expansion coming to Diablo 4 - Lord of Hatred. Set to release on April 28th, Johanna Faries describes this reveal as "a kickstart to this huge 2026 for Blizzard." In addition to the latest Diablo 4 expansion, Faries also highlights that 2026 will be the Diablo franchise’s 30th anniversary, so could there be even more surprises in store? World of Warcraft WoW's latest expansion, Midnight, is set to launch on March 2nd, with the pre-patch event beginning on January 20th. In addition to the pre-patch event, players will also be able to play the new Devourer Demon Hunter Specialisation and create the latest Class/Race combination with Void Elf Demon Hunters! Overwatch While Blizzard Entertainment and the Diablo franchise will be celebrating milestone anniversaries in 2026, the year will also mark the 10th Anniversary of the Overwatch franchise! BlizzCon 2026 is the first year that BlizzCon will return since 2023. Johanna Faries states that the team is not only excited for the event itself, but for what is to come even before BlizzCon in September. Blizzard's President states that 2024 and 2025 were skipped to "give our employees time to put on the best show possible for our community.” BlizzCon 2026 announcement trailer While Faries states that they have taken notes from what leadership has presented at previous BlizzCon events, she hopes to bring in new ideas and surprises for the fans of Blizzard Entertainment. Johanna Faries We really think about, what would speak to our fans? What do they want to see? What’s bread and butter expectation? What are the surprises that we can bring? How do we expand the scope of what BlizzCon can be? What are you most looking forward to in 2026? Let us know your thoughts in the comments down below!

title: New Achievements Unlock Mounted Lumber Gathering on Midnight Beta
content: As we continue to explore the Midnight beta, we've discovered some new Achievements that could make Lumber Gathering a whole lot easier. According to these new achievements, once a player gathers 250 Lumber from a specific continent, they will unlock the ability to Harvest Lumber while mounted in those Zones! Make Gold With Lumber Gathering Currently, in the Beta, these Achievements do not appear to be rewarded retroactively. This means that players will need to harvest 250 Lumber from each continent after Midnight releases, in order to unlock Mounted Harvesting in those Zones. What do you think of Mounted Lumber Harvesting coming to Midnight? Do you think these Achievements should apply retroactively? Let us know your thoughts in the comments down below!

title: Midnight Log-In Title Screen Music
content: With the latest Beta build for Midnight, we now have new title screen music to go along with the expansion log-in screen! Theme by Jake Lefkowitz. This theme is likely work-in-progress, as it is much shorter than the typical 10-12 minute suites for title screen music. Keen ears might recognize it as a variant of Xal'atath's theme from The War Within, continuing into Midnight with her role as the primary antagonist. Theme by Leo Kaliski and Neal Acree.

title: Midnight Season 1 Dungeon Tuning for Nexus-Point Xenas and Magisters’ Terrace
content: Blizzard has made several more tuning adjustments to the Nexus-Point Xenas and Magisters' Terrace dungeons coming in Midnight Season 1! Hello, we have made the following changes to beta: Nexus-Point Xenas General Reduced creature density on the final platform Shadowguard Defender Null Sunder Armor reduction reduced to 3% per stack Initial damage reduced by 80% Flux Engineer Suppression Field Periodic damage reduced by 75% Corewright Kasreth Corespark Detonation Damage increased by 150% Circuit Seer Arcing Mana Periodic damage reduced by 38% Dreadflail Void Lash Damage spells renamed from Melee to Void Damage reduced by 33% Lothraxion Movement speed increased by 40% Searing Rend Cooldown increased Impact damage reduced by 16% Periodic damage reduced by 11% Magisters’ Terrace Runed Spellbreaker Runic Wound Now prefers to bounce towards players without the debuff Arcane Shield Removed Hollowsoul Shredder Dimensional Shred Now teleports to front of the target Seranel Sunlash Wave of Silence Damage reduced by 25% Null Reaction Damage reduced by 16% Gemellus Now triplicates 5 sec into the encounter and at 50% health Neural Link Updated visuals on target players Now has a 3 sec cast time Cosmic Sting Cast time increased to 4 sec Now creates Void Secretions on target location upon impact Void Secretions Now only occurs with Cosmic Sting
